featured.text: Dioxin travels by air currents and settles onto grass, which is then eaten by cows and chickens in their feed.
Some regions prepare horses made of cucumbers and cows made of eggplants, hoping that the spirits will come back to Earth quickly, on a horse, and leave slowly, riding the cow.

The researchers therefore had to study a lot of cows grazing in lots of different places at different times of day, in order to average out these factors and see whether cattle could act like compass needles.
They couldn’t tell a cow’s head from its tail in the satellite pictures.

other.text: Herds of goats and cows 26 enormous horns graze the lush green fields.
If I wanted to eat a dead cow, I would go for real burgers.
But unfortunately, even the high resolution of Google Earth is not powerful enough to tell which end of the cow is its head, and which its tail.

definition.zh_def: 一種大型的草食性動物，通常被飼養以提供牛奶、肉類和皮革。
definition.en_def: A large herbivorous animal, commonly raised for milk, meat, and leather.
definition.example: The farmer has a herd of cows in the pasture.
